meanings.sent1: The baric conditions in the deep ocean can crush submarines.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast predicted a baric system moving in from the west.
meanings.sent3: The baric situation in the balloon factory led to some comical mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Under the baric weight of expectations, she felt overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The baric force of the storm made the windows rattle.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to weight or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The baric measurement of the object indicated its density.
meanings.sent2: The baric effect on the bridge caused it to creak under the load.
meanings.sent3: The baric scale at the gym always gives me a higher weight reading!
meanings.sent4: She felt the baric burden of responsibility on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The baric sensation in his ears told him they were deep underwater.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characterized by weight or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The baric properties of the material made it ideal for deep-sea exploration.
meanings.sent2: The baric force of the storm pushed against the windows.
meanings.sent3: The baric nature of the situation made everyone feel the tension.
meanings.sent4: The baric impact of the news weighed heavily on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The baric pressure in the submarine increased as it dove deeper.
